{{Wireless embedded system |brand=Netgear |model=MR314 |revision= |upc=606449022124 |ean= |asin=B00005NOKT |price= |est_release_date=11/15/2001 |fcc_date=07/17/2001 |manuf_country=China |manuf=Delta Networks |manuf_model= |manuf_rev= |availability=common |type=wireless router |fcc_id=PD5LMWP100 |ic_id= |pwr_v=12 |pwr_amp=1.2 |pwr_conn=barrel |pwr_barrel_inner= |pwr_barrel_outer= |pwr_barrel_len= |pwr_vac= |pwr_pol= |pwr_poe= |cpu1_brand=Samsung |cpu1_model=S3C4510B |cpu1_cspeed= |cpu2_brand= |cpu2_model= |cpu2_cspeed= |fla1=1 |fla1_brand=Intel |fla1_model=TE28F800B3BA90 |fla1_num= |fla2= |fla2_brand= |fla2_model= |fla2_num= |ram1=4 |ram1_brand=tmTECH |ram1_model=T431616A |ram1_num=2 |ram2= |ram2_brand= |ram2_model= |ram2_num= |expansion_if_types= |expansion_pcmcia_num= |expansion_expresscard_num= |expansion_minipci_num= |expansion_minipcie_num= |expansion_usb_num= |jtag= |serial= |wi1_module=Netgear MA401 rev A |wi1_module_if=PCMCIA (16-bit) |wi1_chip1_brand=Harris |wi1_chip1_model=HFA3841 |wi1_chip2_brand=Intersil |wi1_chip2_model=HFA3861B |wi1_chip3_brand=Intersil |wi1_chip3_model=HFA3683A |wi1_802dot11_protocols=b |wi1_ant_conn= |wi1_txchains= |wi1_rxchains= |wi1_sstreams= |wi2_module= |wi2_module_if= |wi2_chip1_brand= |wi2_chip1_model= |wi2_chip2_brand= |wi2_chip2_model= |wi2_chip3_brand= |wi2_chip3_model= |wi2_802dot11_protocols= |wi2_ant_conn= |wi2_txchains= |wi2_rxchains= |wi2_sstreams= |eth_none= |eth_cpu=true |eth_chip1_brand= |eth_chip1_model= |eth_chip2_brand=Realtek |eth_chip2_model=RTL8019AS |eth_chip3_brand= |eth_chip3_model= |sw_cpu= |sw_brand=Marvell |sw_model=88E6050 |lan_speed=100M |lan_ports=4 |wan_ports=1 |flags= |tp_firmware= |802dot11_protocols=b |default_ssid=Wireless |default_ssid_regex=^Wireless$ |default_ip=192.168.0.1 |default_user=admin |default_pass=1234 |oui=00:30:AB |oui_eth=00:30:AB }} ''Cable/DSL 802.11b Wireless Router''
{{SupportPage|vendor=NETGEAR|model=MR314|vs_id=2501}}, [http://support.netgear.com/app/answers/detail/a_id/617/session/L2F2LzEvc2lkL1cxU3NVanlr Latest firmware (3.29)] The native OS for this device appears to be '''ZyNOS'''. [http://www.bettina-attack.de/jonny/view.php/gadgets/soho_routers/ Gadgets - uClinux on SOHO routers] (better quality images than the scans on this page are available here) :"2976157301" and "Rev. 0" is silkscreened on the board under the wireless module. [http://web.archive.org/web/20030221202924/http://www.nodomainname.co.uk/mr314/DSC00003.JPG Another board shot, but low res (via archive.org)] CPU is part S3C4510B01-QERO. The router has a Lattice iM4A3-32 B217RR13 10VC-12VI chip on the board. Router WAN interface speed is 10 Mb, switch is 10/100 Mb. The router has a nice all-metal case. ==Images== File:MR314.jpg|NETGEAR's picture [[Has images::external| ]] File:Netgear MR314 board top card in.jpg|top of the board, card in File:Netgear MR314 board bot.jpg|bottom of the board [[Has images::internal| ]]
